result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maria D Thomas not in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Maria D Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Adjustment Number: 22A 295726,
Payable Number: 268422,
Receipt Number: 22R 017654,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Maria D Thomas in court.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Keith Venema for defendant. State is charging, Attorney Venema is requesting to proceed with the initial appearance. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.J.T. dob 8-28-1976 or RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Maria Denise B Thomas in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State. Attorney Jason Daane for bond purposes. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
